metadata.Title: CVE-2018-6129 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Out of bounds array access in WebRTC in Google Chrome prior to 67.0.3396.62allowed a remote attacker to potentially perform out of bounds memoryaccess via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6129` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '67.0.3396.99-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
